official_title: Affiliated Associate Arts Professor, NYU Shanghai; Global Network Professor, Associate Vice Chancellor for Global Network Academic Planning, Tisch, NYU
bio:
Marianne Petit is Associate Arts Professor at Tisch School of the Arts at New York University. She is also codirector of her own organization, Greylock Arts. She holds an MPS, an MA, and a BA from New York University.

Petit’s artwork has appeared internationally in festivals and exhibitions, including a recent display at the Mass MoCA's Kidspace. She has been featured in WIRED and on IFC and PBS. In addition, her pop-up books are in numerous collections including the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, the Berlin Public Library, and the Boston Public Library. For more information, please visit her New York University page.

Courses Taught

  • Communications Lab
  • Paper Art: History and Practice
  • Animation and Dynamic Surfaces

Education

  • MPS, Interactive Telecommunications Program, New York University, 1991
  • MA, Studio Art/Printmaking, New York University, 1986
  • BA, Studio Art/Art, New York University, 1985
